alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 25 at 1:40PM PST until December 28 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 9 to 11 feet through Wednesday night. Local sets to 13 feet this afternoon. Surf building to 15 to 19 feet Thursday. Dangerous rip currents can be expected. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches and Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches. * WHEN...Until 3 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. Pooling of sea water is possible around high tide at beach and harbor areas that is uncommon with normal tidal ranges. Enhanced beach erosion is also possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very large surf is expected to continue Thursday night through at least Saturday. This very large surf combined with relatively high tides of 6.0 to 6.5 feet may result in more significant coastal flooding and beach erosion. This could require the issuance of a coastal flood advisory as we draw closer to the event.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly locations in such conditions, so stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
